SEARCH
Package com.paradegame.model

Class Card

java.lang.Object
com.paradegame.model.Card
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Card>
public class Card extends Object implements Comparable<Card>
Represents a card with a colour and a value. The card can be flipped and its value can be modified to 1 for score calculation. It also supports colour-coded output for printing.

  • Constructor Details

    • Card

      public Card(Colour colour, int value)
      Construct a new Card with the specified colour and value.
      Parameters:
      colour - the colour of the card
      value - the numerical value of the card

  • Method Details

    • getColour

      public Colour getColour()
      Gets the colour of the card
      Returns:
      The colour of the card

    • getValue

      public int getValue()
      Gets the value of the card
      Returns:
      The value of the card

    • setValue

      public void setValue(int value)
      Sets value of the card. This method is used to change the card's value to 1 during the flipping process, which occurs when calculating scores.
      Parameters:
      value - The new value of the card.

    • setFlipped

      public void setFlipped(boolean flipped)
      Sets the flip status of the card
      Parameters:
      flipped - true if the card is flipped, false otherwise.

    • isFlipped

      public boolean isFlipped()
      Checks whether the card is flipped.
      Returns:
      true if the card is flipped, false otherwise.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Card other)
      Compares this card to another card based on their values.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Card>
      Parameters:
      other - The other card to compare with.
      Returns:
      A negative integer if this card has a lower value, zero if both cards have the same value, or a positive integer if this card has a higher value.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the card. If ANSI colors are enabled, the card's colour is displayed with corresponding ANSI codes.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A formatted string representation of the card.
